SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AnalyticsScreen
The AnalyticsScreen class provides a user interface for displaying analytics related to menu items, sales, and other data relevant to a restaurant or food service business.
App
The RevsPOS.App class is the entry point for Revs POS system, it sets up the database connection, initializes the main JFrame, and handles navigation between the different screens.
AuthScreen
Represents the authentication screen.
ButtonColumn
The ButtonColumn class provides a renderer and an editor that looks like a JButton.
CustomCheckBox
CustomCheckBox is a JButton that toggles between two states, similar to a checkbox.
CustomerOrder
Represents a customer order within the system, containing order details, employee handling the order, and order status information.
CustomerOrderScreen
Represents the customer order screen.
IngredientsPopup
A dialog window for managing ingredients related to a specific item.
InventoryItem
Represents an inventory item in the system, including details such as item ID, name, quantity type, price, current stock, and reorder level.
InventoryScreen
The InventoryScreen class provides an interface for users to interact with the inventory, menu items, and customer orders.
ItemOrdered
Represents an item ordered by a customer, containing details about the order item.
Log
Provides a centralized logging utility for the application, allowing for the creation of loggers that write output to a specified log file.
MenuItem
Represents the MenuItem table within the database
MenuItemPair
Represents a pair of menu items that are commonly sold together.
OutlineButton
OutlineButton is a customized JButton that features a distinctive outline style.
Page
Defines the pages available in the application.
PageAction
Manages the navigation and visibility of different screens within the application.
PinForm
Represents a PIN input form with functionality to clear and submit the PIN.
RegisterScreen
The RegisterScreen class provides a GUI for registering new employees, allowing the input of employee details such as name, email, and manager status.
SQL
Class that facilitates interactions with the database, this includes functions that query and modify values within the database.
Style
Defines the style constants used throughout the application.
WelcomeScreen
The WelcomeScreen class represents the initial screen of the application where users are greeted and presented with several options including clocking in/out for employees, accessing manager functions, and registering new employees.
